reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Le Walt is steps from the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides, offers spotless, comfortable and well-decorated rooms and, surprisingly, doesn't cost a small fortune. While one should never spend too much time in a hotel room when Paris is just waiting to be seen, the retreats at the end of the day were made all the better by the attentive service, friendly staff and lovely amenities. Truly deserving of its boutique hotel description, we'll definitely be back!
reviews.title: Lovely location, fantastic value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is wonderful. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower that sparkled at night. The hotel is clean with a comfortable bed. The bathroom is kind of small, but no worries. The location is the key. It is right across the street from the metro stop and a block away from Rue Cler, the best place to pretend to be a local. The fresh fruit, creperie, wine store, and picnic supplies are all within a stroll down Rue Cler. There is a grocery store right across the street from the hotel, so you can purchase water, cheese, whatever you need for a picnic. Buy lunch here, take the metro to the Tuilleries Garden and have a picnic. It doesn't get better than this. We loved it so much we have booked for 5 nights this summer.
reviews.title: We've booked again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The double room was spacious by Paris boutique hotel standards. The location was absolutely perfect We would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Le Walt was perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: Excellent boutique hotel option. Great location to main tourist attractions, metro right outside and some fantastic Parisian cafes on the doorstep. You really can't go wrong with this hotel if you are a tourist. Highly recommended for all age groups.
reviews.title: Anniversary in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Location!!!!!
reviews.title: Around the corner from the Eiffel Tower and metro station right across the street.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Big clean bathroom with robes and slippers... windows that opened to let in fresh air... cormfortable bed with white duvet... great location near the Eiffel Tower and Rue Cler (open-air market)... friendly staff... free use of laptop in the lobby... delightful stay!
reviews.title: Clean and chic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked months in advance and requested a view of the Eiffel Tower. This was our last few days in Paris and we had decided to splurge. They led us to believe we would get a view, but had no intention of accommodating us.We wouldn't have minded not having a view, but why couldn't they be HONEST about it? Must be a French thing!!
reviews.title: Don't count on a view, even if you book way in advance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was nice enough, but very small which is typical. It was clean and had decent amenities like the shampoo, etc. Free internet computer in the lobby, always a plus.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night, even though we had booked 3 nights. The disinterested clerk could care less.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been to Paris many times, but this time I found the French attitude to be a real pain.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, cozy, with good amenities, in an excellent situation close to Tour Eiffel and Ecole Militaire.
reviews.title: Nice and good hotel; BAD RECEPTIONIST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: The only porblme is a women receptionist who really is very unporfessional not at all warm, at the contrary very rude with clients.
reviews.title: Will most definitely be going back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I booked for 2 periods and when I arrived with collegues the scond time, they sent me to another 4 stars hotel of the same company but absolutely not the same, and it is cheaper. I already paid rhe walt.
reviews.title: Out of the way gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Not for comming again with these kind of receptionist
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and great staff. Wonderful location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Le Walt exceeded expectations staff are excellent hotel itself is wonderful and is in a perfect location
reviews.title: Good location, poor hotel
sooo cute!
reviews.text: one of the cutest boutique hotels in paris! i totally recommend staying here. Nice rooms and large bathrooms! very close to metro and clean part of paris.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed in Paris on either side of a trip to Provence. We stayed at the Le Walt first and another hotel in the Latin Quarter on the return. The LeWalt was truly a wonderful experience in every way. We arrived the day of a taxi strike and had to walk from Les Invalides entrace about 4 blocks to the hotel with our luggage in tow. At that point, we were about ready to drop, especially after the transatlantic fllight. The woman at the desk was wonderful. Just a charming person, very polite. Offered us a beverage, had our room ready and offered help with our luggage.
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was perfect. I had requested a nice room because it was a special event and was not disappointed. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower and the tree-lined streets around the hotel. The room was spotless, the bathroom beautiful and large by Paris standards. The bed was large and extremely comfortable. We had breakfast in the hotel every day, although it would have been easy to go a block and eat at any of the cafe's on Rue Cler and had a great meal. The proximity to the metro (right across the street) and many attractions and restaurants can't be beat.
reviews.title: Noisy if on lower levels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: More than anything, though, the staff was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. Charlotte, who helped us a lot, was great. She made dinner reservations for us at several wonderful little places not in the guide books. She helped book a tour for us. Called a cab when we needed one and loan us umbrellas when it rained.
reviews.title: Le Walt Review

likes.disliked: — Help from front desk not consistent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay here again any time.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — breakfast was limited and did not look fresh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Walt and I have to say, it does exactly what it says on the tin. The photos I had seen were a true reflection of what I got.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel

likes.liked: — It was clean and had character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK, so the rooms are quite small but if you're after a nice room and hotel that has a boutique feel to it, you can't go wrong with this hotel. It's very decent and while it may not rival Hotel Costes and the other legandary Paris hotels, this really is a little gem.
reviews.title: Dream Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I booked our Paris trip through the Eurostar website about a month in advance as we were travelling the day after Valentines day.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — No mirror in the bedroom and cost of alcoholic drinks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our hotel check in time was at 2o'clock and we arrived 15 minutes early, and as we were early we were given a choice of two rooms and we were shown both rooms before we made a decision.....Result....we choose the slightly smaller room on the 6th floor as it had a perfect view of the Eiffel Tower....The room was brilliant and nicely decorated.....the webiste really doesn't do it any justice..the bathroom was a fantastic size and has everything you could need. We were very happy with our choice of hotel, it was in the perfect location and the metro station was right outside the front door so we found the hotel very easily ! The only thing missing from the room was tea facilities, this being our first trip to paris we didn't relise this wouldn't be supplied and if you order tea at breakfast make sure you ask for it with milk!!! All in all we had a fantastric trip !!
reviews.title: Very nice Paris hotel - wonderful location

likes.disliked: — No major dislikes, but might not be a choice for the busy business traveler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We've just come back from two days in Paris and stayed at this Hotel based upon the consistent good comments on Trip Advisor, plus the recommendation from Trip Advisor in their PDF on Paris.
reviews.title: Great Service, Very Kind and Helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms in the Hotel Le Walt are above average in size by Paris standards and very clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is wonderful - down the street from Rue Cler, an open-air market, within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, next to a metro station and nearby to many good restaurants and bakeries.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I booked this hotel for a family trip to Paris to celebrate my mother's 60th Birthday. We stayed for three nights and by the end of our stay I could not wait to return home. I travel alot on business and stay in many hotels on a monthly basis and have never disliked any as much as this. It is rated as a 4 star hotel but I personally would classify it as a 2 star bed and breakfast rather than hotel as it has none of the facilities you would expect from a hotel. It's location is not for the faint hearted as all the attractions are a lengthy walk away. The breakfast is very expensive and in my opinion, of a poor standard. The 'superior' rooms we stayed in were very worn and dated and didn't even have coffee making facilities, something I have always been offered even when staying in a budget Travel Lodge.
reviews.title: I will never return to this 'hotel'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I think it would be wise for the manager of this establishment to remind the staff that the guests that come here are coming for a break or vacation and so are there to have a nice time. I found the staff to be completely miserable and far from accomadating. One particular receptionist working in the mornings was nothing short of rude and obnoxioys, she appears to hate her job and finds any communication with guests an annoyance.
reviews.title: Perfect location for sightseeing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My advise to anyone considering this hotel is simply dont, keep looking and go elsewhere!
reviews.title: a fantastic hotel with excellent service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found this hotel, browsing on Trip Advisor. Booked directly on their web page. At arrival, checkin was quick and easy. I took the executive room (28m2) to have more floor space. Good move because it's not that big but still good for Paris. Maybe we are spoiled in North america, our standard hotel rooms being in the range of 40+m2. I can't imaging what the smaller rooms look like... One helpful detail: the room type (executive, superior, etc.) is written on the room card located on the back of the door. This avoids arguments on the room type. The wall portrait is spectacular but it's the only decoration. The other walls are white and the furniture is plain. Flat screen tv, dvd player and minibar are provided. I liked the wooden floor but the downside is that you hear every move of your neighbour above. They should, at least, put felt pads under the chair legs. The bathroom is clean and well equipped. The bed was good and firm. I gave a - on the sleep quality because of noisy people opening and closing doors every 5 minutes (really!), from 12h30AM until 2h00 on one night.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay, will definitely be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely hotel in the 7th. Great location near three nice cafes and shopping. Metro stop is two businesses down. Charming Rue Clare is 1/2 block away. Beautiful boutique hotel, small but elegant. Our room was lovely and the bath first-rate. Good storage in the bath; a little less in the bedroom, but we still enjoyed it. Very good lighting in room & bath. Staff were all friendly and very helpful. Went from here to the Lutetia in St. Germain-des-Pres to join friends. We much prefer the ambiance of the Le Walt. And, compared to rates at Lutetia, Le Walt's a good value in a quieter neighborhood..
reviews.title: Fantastique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Saw some of the bad reviews on Trip adviser, but was pressed for time and Le Walt was one of few with available rooms- so took a chance. Got a superior room, but I think it was really meant for disabled people because the bedroom itself was small but the bathroom very large (for the turning radius of a wheelchair) and it was ground floor. However, it was comfortable and quiet. The breakfast at the Le Walt was very good. The best thing about this place is the location- right off a major metro station and could walk to the Rue Cler district so highly acclaimed by Rick Steves (it is actually pretty nice). I found the staff at the Le Walt very professional and pleasant. It is a boutique hotel and has that feel. A mix of nationalities staying here: American, Brits, Chinese, and yes- even French. Bathrooms are modern as shown in photos. There was one bad point- we found a cockroach in the bathroom one night. And on the second night. However, I think this is something the smaller hotels are constantly battling in any big city at certain points in time: too close to adjacent restaurants and food. Thus I give them 3 points (neutral/average) instead of Above average.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Le Walt for 7 nights in a deluxe room on the 6th floor. The hotel was a delight -- spotlessly clean, very comfortable bed, and a decent-sized room (for Paris). This was by far the best of four hotels I've visited in Paris, and would be my first choice for future visits. We were there on business (me) and vacation (my wife) and the hotel served very nicely for both purposes.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and service, in a great area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was very quiet and clean, with an armoire, comfortable bed, desk, small table, 2 chairs, and a bathroom with shower/bath combination. Because we were on the top floor, the ceiling was slanted near the wall, which cut a bit into headroom but provided nice dormer windows. Bathroom was very clean and functional, but the shower/bath was a little cramped and tended to splash water around (there was no shower curtain).
reviews.title: lovely

likes.disliked: — noise from the tube below our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for room quiet, I'd note two things. First, the hotel is on a relatively busy street (Avenue de la Motte-Piquet) and rooms are on either the street side or back side facing a courtyard and the backs of apartments. Our room was on the back side, which we loved -- there was no traffic noise and it was very nice to feel "at home" by seeing people in the other apartments. On the street side, on the other hand, the higher-floor rooms would have views of the Eiffel Tower. So there's a tradeoff there. Second, because the hotel is over a Metro station, there was occasional rumbling from trains. Those did not bother us at all, but light sleepers on lower floors might notice them.
reviews.title: A must stay for Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Wonderfull little hotel. Impeccably clean! Comfortable big beds; accommodating and pleasant staff.
reviews.title: Wonderful le Walt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed at the Le Walt in mid July this summer. The staff was very helpful and accomodated all of our requests. The hotel itself has small rooms like many in Paris. Sound carries in the small hallways. I was awoken by other guests who were loud and partying at 2:00 a.m not once but several times as the door to the stairs kept opening and closing.
reviews.title: A Good Option for the 7th

likes.disliked: — Noise from other guests in small hallways

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is very good and the coffee is excellent. They used to have a restaurant for dinner but no longer. As for location, in the 7th it's hard to beat. The Ecole Militaire Metro stop is right out of the front door. Ask for a courtyard room. Rooms on busy Le Motte Piquet may have late night street noise from the bar next door.
reviews.title: Just ok for a honeymoon

likes.liked: — The view of the Eiffel Tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on our honeymoon in May and had in our booking stated, that it was in fact - a honeymoon. When we arrived, there was no bottle of anything to congratulate us, no greetings, no nothing. Well, ok, that was our problem, and since the supermarkets are only on the other side of the road, we managed to pamper ourselves nicely.
reviews.title: Very good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I had specified in my booking, that we wanted a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower which we got. But since another guest had booked the same room in advance, we had to move from that room to another facing the backyard. And after one night, we moved back again, since the room with a view was in fact what we wanted.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay.

likes.disliked: — No iron and board in room.
